metadata.commander_name: Generale di Corpo d'Armata Gastone Gambara

narrative.title: Xx Mobile Corps - 1941Q4
narrative.situation: Italian Mobile Armored Corps deployed in North Africa during 1941Q4.
narrative.objectives: Mobile armored and motorized reserve force for Panzerarmee Afrika. Primary Italian striking force for mobile defense during Operation Crusader. Coordinate with German Afrika Korps while defending Tobruk corridor and Gazala-Bir el Gobi line. Corps committed to blocking British armored thrusts and defending critical supply lines.
narrative.axis_objective: Maintain defensive positions and inflict maximum casualties on Allied forces.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and secure strategic objectives while minimizing casualties.

weather.terrain: coastal desert, wadis, escarpments (Gazala-Bir el Gobi-Sidi Rezegh sector)

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: 223 tanks (largest Italian armored concentration in North Africa in late 1941)
Two-division combined arms force (1 armored, 1 motorized)
Experienced desert warfare from Tobruk siege operations
Mobile defense doctrine under Gambara's leadership
Coordination with German Afrika Korps armored units

environment.terrain_type: coastal desert, wadis, escarpments (Gazala-Bir el Gobi-Sidi Rezegh sector)
